poem:
### Silicon Wings

On rooftops where the wind  
whispers secrets to machines,  
drones rise, unfriendly angels,  
armed with algorithms.  
In their shadows, the earth  
quakes beneath feathers  
of unseen hawks  
hunting at silicon command.  
Progress, a swift predator,  
trims its talons on  
the pulse of tomorrow.
